title: Ticket #6668: Use LibreSSL on Mac OS 10.13 High Sierra
description:
MacOS 10.13 (High Sierra) provides LibreSSL 2.2.7 as the default ssl library under /usr/lib. The older OpenSSL 0.9.8 used in older macOS versions is still available, but we should move away from it when feasible. One downside to switching to LibreSSL is that binaries built on macOS 10.13 won't run on older versions of macOS.

This work is initially on the branch V8_7-gt6668-macos-libressl.
remarks:
2018-May-03 10:57:23 by jfrey:
Condor and Globus have been patched and now build on macOS with LibreSSL. VOMS does not work with LibreSSL. It uses the following three functions, which were removed in LibreSSL:
  • ASN1_verify()
  • ASN1_sign()
  • ASN1_digest()

We can either drop support for VOMS in newer versions of macOS or figure out how to replace these function calls with equivalent code using the current LibreSSL APIs. I've been having trouble finding documentation for how to do the latter. A recent email to the htcondor-users mailing list asking about use of VOMS on macOS received no replies.

2018-Jul-12 14:31:21 by jfrey:
I was able to provide alternate implementations for the OpenSSL functions that VOMS uses.

2018-Jul-17 14:42:36 by jfrey:
Since we build our releases on older versions of macOS, which don't have LibreSSL, this change probably doesn't merit a version history entry.
